greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, a(n) is the largest k <= 1+A046666(n) such that n-k and n-(sigma(n)-k) are relatively prime, or -1 if no such nonnegative k exists.
comment: a(n) is equal to A325817(n) only with odd primes and the even terms of A000396. a(n) = -1 only on odd perfect numbers, if such numbers exist. Otherwise a(n) = 2n - A325961(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 29 2019
